title: Astonishing Common Link Found Between Black Holes and Young Stars
text: Astonishing Common Link Found Between Black Holes and Young Stars 21 Oct , 2015 Share Comparing data from young stars in the latter stages of formation against that from black holes and white dwarfs, the team, which was led by Dr Simon Vaughan from the University of Leicester’s Department of Physics and Astronomy, made an unexpected discovery when it identified similarities in the readings from the discs surrounding black holes and young stars, even though the objects have wildly different properties. Two rambunctious young stars are destroying their natal dust cloud with powerful jets of radiation. “The seemingly random fluctuations we see from the black holes and white dwarfs look remarkably similar to those from the young stellar objects,” said Dr Vaughan. “It is only the tempo that changes.” To explain, the team targeted accretion discs as their object of study as it produced brightness variations around astronomical objects and provided a common ground of study. The instruments put to use were NASA’s Kepler/K2 and ULTRACAM – a superfast camera taking 500 pictures per second in three colours. ESO’s Very Large Telescope and the William Herschel Telescope were also involved in the process. Related Posts:
